title: Send started programs to the "background".
body: Some programs when launched from CMD will "block" CMD until they exit. Allow to run programs so that I can keep on using the CMD window. Similar to bash "<program> &" or hitting CTRL+Z to allow input.

comments.body: I would not consider "Start" a true background job facility.  There's no built-in facility for checking the state of the "job" or to get its output (other than to Wait which is blocking).  Start seems more like a "fire-and-forget" mechanism.  It also doesn't support running jobs on other computers which is something admins need.

The "start" command already does this. Just run "start /?" to see what it offers. You'll see that you can drop immediately back to a prompt without the command finishing first, or open windows in minimized mode.
PowerShell already supports background jobs.  Why bother adding this to CMD which has so many other fundamental limitations?
